title: 115_hr2185
content:
The Act is titled the "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act." It involves determining if foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The President must determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for covered persons every 180 days for up to 5 years. Certifications of these determinations must be submitted to congressional committees in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. The certification described in subsection (a)(2) must be submitted in unclassified form, with the option of a classified annex. Transactions and financial services are deemed significant based on regulations in title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 3. The President must determine if foreign persons listed in specific attachments have supported certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. Determinations will be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex.

SEC. 4. Describes the individuals covered in the Act. A person described in this section is an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property is blocked under various Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction proliferation. Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting exports in connection with the national emergency with respect to Syria, including those targeting human rights abuses and senior officials. Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions with Syria, including measures targeting human rights abuses, senior officials, and foreign sanctions evaders. Executive Order 13606 blocks property and suspends entry into the United States for individuals involved in grave human rights abuses by the governments of Iran and Syria. This includes blocking property of Iranian persons under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. Additionally, it targets Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates, as well as persons acting on their behalf. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, "appropriate congressional committees" refers to committees as defined in the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996. "Foreign financial institution" is defined as per section 1010.605 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. "Foreign person" includes natural persons, entities, and representatives of foreign governments, but excludes certain foreign financial institutions. The term "foreign terrorist organization" refers to any organization designated as such by the Secretary of State. The term "Iranian financial institution" is defined in the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions Act of 2010. The "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action" was agreed upon by Iran and others in Vienna on July 14, 2015. The term "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action" refers to the agreement made in Vienna on July 14, 2015, by Iran and several other countries, including the United States. It was transmitted to Congress on July 19, 2015, as part of the Iran Nuclear Agreement Review Act. The Iran Nuclear Agreement Review Act of 2015 amended definitions related to "person" and "United States person" as per the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996.
